00-.338.146c-.628.582-.676 1.601-.097 2.232l.049.048 3.282 3.3a.47.47 0 010 .68.465.465 0 01-.676 0l-3.282-3.3-5.07-5.095a1.061 1.061 0 00-.723-.292c-.58 0-1.063.486-1.063 1.068a.99.99 0 00.29.728l5.407 5.386a.47.47 0 010 .68.465.465 0 01-.676 0L12.6 7.473 10.428 5.29c-.194-.194-.483-.34-.773-.29-.29 0-.58.145-.772.339a1.075 1.075 0 00.096 1.504l1.449 1.408 6.13 6.211a.47.47 0 010 .68.465.465 0 01-.675 0l-6.18-6.212c-.193-.194-.482-.34-.772-.291-.29 0-.58.145-.772.34-.049.048-.097.097-.097.145 0 0 0 .049-.048.049 0 .048-.048.048-.048.097v.048c0 .049 0 .097-.049.146v.242c0 .049 0 .097.049.146V9.9c0 .048.048.097.048.145v.049c.048.145.145.242.241.34l2.028 2.038 4.055 4.076a.47.47 0 010 .68.465.465 0 01-.676 0L9.607 13.15c-.097-.097-.193-.194-.338-.243-.145-.048-.241-.048-.386-.097h-.048c-.049 0-.145 0-.194.049a.917.917 0 00-.53.34c-.145.145-.194.339-.242.533v.437c0 .048 0 .097.048.097 0 .049 0 .049.049.097.048.048.048.048.048.097s.048.049.048.097c0 .049.048.049.048.097 0 .049.097.146.097.194l6.565 6.551a7.19 7.19 0 008.207 1.408c.049 0 .097-.049.145-.049.773-.388 1.497-.97 2.076-1.601zM4.683 18.343l6.517 6.6c2.172 2.232 5.552 2.766 8.352 1.359.772-.389 1.496-.97 2.124-1.602.145-.145.29-.34.386-.485a8.45 8.45 0 01-2.22.291h-.532c-.144 0-.338 0-.482-.048h-.049c-.29-.049-.579-.098-.917-.146-.048 0-.096-.049-.145-.049l-.434-.145a.365.365 0 01-.193-.097c-.193-.097-.435-.146-.628-.243l-.29-.145-.29-.146c-.144-.097-.289-.145-.434-.243-.096-.048-.193-.097-.241-.145a2.655 2.655 0 0 00.097 1.504l2.075 2.086 4.056 4.077a.47.47 0 010 .68.465.465 0 01-.676 0l-4.055-4.077c-.193-.194-.483-.34-.773-.291-.29 0-.58.145-.772.34-.483.485-.435 1.164 0 1.552z" stroke="currentColor" 0 012.094 0L.112.85c.084.086.216.15.37.15A.525.525 0 00.855.85L-.564-.56zm2.094 0l2.896 2.912-1.418 1.41L.112.851 1.53-.56zm2.896 2.912a1.47 1.47 0 010 2.09l-1.418-1.41a.52.52 0 00-.146.365c0 .15.062.28.146.365l1.418-1.41z" fill="currentColor"></path></g><mask id="c" maskUnits="userSpaceOnUse" x="-1" y="3" width="5" height="3"><path d="M0 4.173c.097-.242.386-.388.628-.29l2.413.97c.242.097.387.388.29.63-.097.195-.241.292-.434.292-.049 0-.145 0-.194-.049L.29 4.756c-.242-.049-.387-.291-.29-.583z" fill="#fff"></path></mask><g mask="url(#c)"><path d="M0 4.173l-.95-.314.01-.028.01-.027.93.37zm.628-.29l-.373.927.373-.928zm2.413.97l.373-.928-.373.928zm.29.63l.93.37-.016.039-.019.037-.895-.445zm-.628.243l.373-.928.191.077.145.146-.709.705zM.29 4.756l.197-.98.09.017.086.035-.373.928zm-1.22-.952c.274-.687 1.108-1.18 1.93-.85L.256 4.81c.177.071.337.04.434-.007a.48.48 0 00.24-.26l-1.858-.74zM1 2.954l2.414.97-.746 1.857L.255 4.81 1 2.954zm2.414.97c.69.278 1.17 1.114.846 1.93l-1.858-.74a.537.537 0 00.006.426.48.48 0 00.26.24l.746-1.855zm.812 2.005a1.545 1.545 0 01-.52.604c-.254.17-.537.242-.81.242v-2a.558.558 0 00-.46.263l1.79.891zm-1.33.846c-.018 0-.132.002-.261-.02a1.172 1.172 0 01-.64-.324l1.417-1.41a.87.87 0 00-.447-.239c-.056-.01-.098-.007-.068-.007v2zm-.566-.121l-2.413-.97.746-1.856 2.413.97-.746 1.856zM.093 5.736a1.388 1.388 0 01-.96-.714 1.482 1.482 0 01-.082-1.163l1.898.63a.522.522 0 00-.046-.4.612.612 0 00-.416-.314L.093 5.736z" fill="currentColor"></path></g><mask id="d" maskUnits="userSpaceOnUse" x="3" y="0" width="3" height="4"><path d="M5.503 3.348c-.241.097-.53 0-.627-.242L3.717.679c-.096-.242 0-.534.242-.63.241-.098.53 0 .627.242l1.159 2.426c.096.243 0 .534-.242.631z" fill="#fff"></path></mask><g mask="url(#d)"><path d="M4.876 3.106l.902-.431.015.03.012.03-.93.37zM3.717.679l-.902.431-.015-.03-.012-.031.93-.37zm.87-.388l-.903.431-.015-.03L3.657.66l.93-.37zm1.158 2.426l.902-.43.015.03.012.03-.93.37zm.131 1.56c-.664.266-1.594.041-1.93-.802l1.859-.74a.563.563 0 00-.322-.318.486.486 0 00-.353.003l.746 1.856zm-1.903-.74L2.815 1.11 4.62.248l1.158 2.427-1.805.862zM2.788 1.049c-.262-.658-.046-1.59.798-1.928L4.332.976A.562.562 0 004.65.653.478.478 0 004.646.31l-1.858.739zm.798-1.928c.664-.268 1.594-.043 1.93.8l-1.859.74c.067.169.2.274.322.32.116.042.24.04.353-.005L3.586-.879zm1.903.74l1.158 2.425-1.805.862L3.684.722 5.489-.14zm1.185 2.487c.262.658.046 1.589-.798 1.928L5.13 2.42a.562.562 0 00-.318.323.478.478 0 00.004.344l1.858-.74z" fill="currentColor"></path></g></g><defs><clipPath id="clip0"><path fill="#fff" d="M0 0h28v28H0z"></path></clipPath></defs></svg><span class="LikeButton_likeCount__Og0Fo likeCounterGroup"></span></button></div></div><div data-tracking-id="" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 text-step-1 leading-m font-medium text-grey-900" data-gtm-component="text"><p>Biological immortality is exceptionally rare.</p>
<p>Despite numerous memes that suggest lobsters can live forever, these crustaceans are bound to a mortal existence, just like us.&nbsp;</p></div></article><div data-tracking-id="text-text-f4021cdded" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 " id="text-f4021cdded" data-gtm-component="text"><p>Discover how long lobsters live, how big they get and why scientists think they dont act their age.</p>
<h2>What is a lobster?</h2>
<p>While lots of animals are known as lobsters, for example, spiny lobsters, squat lobsters and slipper lobsters, this term is more formally used to refer to the true lobsters  <a href="/our-science/services/collections/zoology/crustaceans.html">crustaceans</a> in the taxonomic family Nephropidae.</p>
<p>This group includes well known, commercially valuable species, such as the European lobster, <i>Homarus gammarus</i>, and American lobster, <i>Homarus americanus</i>.</p>
<h2>How long do lobsters live?</h2>
<p>Working out how old lobsters are can be difficult and scientists have tried a variety of methods. In lots of other animals, experts can use growth bands left behind on hard structures, such as bones or scales, to determine the age of an individual.<br>
</p>
<p>But this method doesnt really work for lobsters. Lobsters shed their entire exoskeleton when they grow and retain no hard structures. The size and weight of the animal helps us guess their age, but its not a reliable way to determine it accurately.</p>
<p>Instead, scientists have tried looking at the <a target="_blank" href="https://cdnsciencepub.com/doi/abs/10.1139/f99-116" rel="noopener">fat residue on the eyestalks</a>, assuming older lobsters would have stored up more fat.</p>
<p>They found that, on average, male European lobsters live to 31 years old, and females to 54. There were a few exceptions  one particularly long-lived female had was found to be 72 years old.</p></div><figure id="image-29633d86de" data-gtm-component="image-component" data-tracking-id="image-image-29633d86de"><picture><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png" media="(max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png" media="(max-width: 619px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png" media="(max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png" media="(max-width: 959px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png" media="(max-width: 1023px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png" media="(max-width: 1159px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png" media="(max-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png" media="(min-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><img class="Image_image__QGXjU undefined" loading="lazy" src="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg" width="753" height="435" alt="An adult European lobster on a sandy seabed"/></picture><div data-tracking-id=""><figcaption class=" text-step--1 max-w-page mx-auto !text-step--1 String-module_styledLinks__5gc3W" data-tracking-id="" id=":Rhl5l6:"><p>The idea that lobsters live forever is a myth. These animals can face death from predation, disease or even exhaustion when they moult, for example.  Becky Gill/ Shutterstock</p></figcaption></div></figure><div data-tracking-id="text-text-aa2d7e039f" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 " id="text-aa2d7e039f" data-gtm-component="text"><p>Lobsters certainly do not live forever. Its not entirely clear where this myth originated, but its a claim that persists online, often in the form of memes. Given the right circumstances, <a href="/discover/immortal-jellyfish-secret-to-cheating-death.html">some animals could be considered immortal</a>, but lobsters are not among them.</p>
<p>Like many other decapod  ten-footed  crustaceans, lobsters continue to grow throughout their lives. Scientists call this indeterminate growth. This contrasts with people, for example  we stop growing when we reach adulthood.</p>
<p>But lobsters and other decapods do eventually reach the end of their lives.</p>
<p>Lobsters can face death from predation, including by humans, or health issues such as <a target="_blank" href="https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/science-blog/lobster-shell-disease" rel="noopener">shell disease</a>.</p>
<p>Another potential cause of death is inherently linked to their continuous growth. When theyre young, lobsters grow rapidly, shedding their exoskeleton multiple times a year. Over time, growth slows down and moulting becomes less frequent. But for each successive moult, increasing amounts of energy are needed and eventually the cost is too high and lobsters can die from exhaustion. One lobster expert has suggested that that <a target="_blank" href="https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/dont-listen-to-the-buzz-lobsters-arent-actually-immortal-88450872/?no-ist" rel="noopener">1015% of lobsters go out this way</a>.</p></div><figure id="image-52f064bc8a" data-gtm-component="image-component" data-tracking-id="image-image-52f064bc8a"><picture><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png" media="(max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png" media="(max-width: 619px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png" media="(max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png" media="(max-width: 959px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png" media="(max-width: 1023px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png" media="(max-width: 1159px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png" media="(max-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png" media="(min-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><img class="Image_image__QGXjU undefined" loading="lazy" src="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg" width="753" height="435" alt="A lobster carrying thousands of small green eggs on their underside. It has a v-notch on its tail to indicate it is an egg-bearing female lobster."/></picture><div data-tracking-id=""><figcaption class=" text-step--1 max-w-page mx-auto !text-step--1 String-module_styledLinks__5gc3W" data-tracking-id="" id=":Ril5l6:"><p>A female lobster carrying eggs on its underside. The lobster life cycle begins with a female producing thousands of eggs, but only a few will survive to adulthood, and even fewer to enormous sizes.  Lost_in_the_Midwest/ Shutterstock</p></figcaption></div></figure><div data-tracking-id="text-text-a026748b9a" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 " id="text-a026748b9a" data-gtm-component="text"><h2>How big can lobsters get?</h2>
<p>Lobsters may not be able to grow forever, but they can reach impressive sizes.</p>
<p>American lobsters are larger and heavier than their European relatives. A metre-long specimen, caught off the coast of Nova Scotia, Canada in 1977, weighed in at 20.14 kilogrammes (44lbs 6oz). This is the largest lobster ever caught and currently holds the record as the <a target="_blank" href="https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/70881-heaviest-marine-crustacean" rel="noopener">worlds heaviest marine crustacean</a>.</p>
<p>This isnt the only big lobster to have been pulled from the <a href="/discover/oceans.html">ocean</a>. Two individuals from the Virginia Capes, affectionately known as Mike and Ike, are held in the collection at the <a target="_blank" href="https://www.mos.org/" rel="noopener">Museum of Science, Boston</a>. These colossal crustaceans weighed in at 19 kilogrammes (42lbs) and 17.2 kilogrammes (38lbs) respectively.</p>
<p>Rumours of heavier specimens have come and gone. Most have been unconfirmed, such as a 1939 claim of a 21.3-kilogramme (47lbs) giant lobster living off the coast of New Jersey, and a huge 21.7 kilogramme (48lbs) individual said to have been caught near Chatham, Massachusetts.</p>
<p>To imagine just how huge these lobsters would have been, we can compare to ones diners might be familiar with. For example, in Maine, a state with a large commercial lobster industry, there are now fishing regulations that detail a minimum and maximum size for lobsters that can be caught and kept. Any lobsters found to have a carapace  the part of the hardened exoskeleton that protects the head and thorax  of over 12.7 centimetres long must be returned to the ocean. Lobsters this size often weigh around 1.31.8 kilogrammes (3-4 lbs).</p>
<p>From the thousands of eggs female lobsters can produce, only a small number will make it to adulthood, and far fewer to extreme sizes.</p></div><figure id="image-91821eae63" data-gtm-component="image-component" data-tracking-id="image-image-91821eae63"><picture><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png" media="(max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png" media="(max-width: 619px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png" media="(max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png" media="(max-width: 959px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png" media="(max-width: 1023px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png" media="(max-width: 1159px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png" media="(max-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png" media="(min-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><img class="Image_image__QGXjU undefined" loading="lazy" src="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg" width="753" height="435" alt="A captured lobster with rubber bands holding its claws closed"/></picture><div data-tracking-id=""><figcaption class=" text-step--1 max-w-page mx-auto !text-step--1 String-module_styledLinks__5gc3W" data-tracking-id="" id=":Rjl5l6:"><p>In Maine, lobsters that can be caught and kept usually weigh between 1.31.8 kilogrammes. Theyre tiny when compared to the colossal 20.14 kilogramme lobster that currently holds the record as the worlds heaviest lobster.  Celso Pizzolato/ Shutterstock</p></figcaption></div></figure><div data-tracking-id="text-text-1ae8e92abd" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 " id="text-1ae8e92abd" data-gtm-component="text"><h2>What is senescence?<br>
</h2>
<p>Biological aging, also known as senescence, is the deterioration of an organisms body and bodily functions, which make it more likely to die and less likely to reproduce.</p>
<p>Aging is complex. There are <a target="_blank" href="https://iubmb.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1080/15216540601178067" rel="noopener">more than 300 theories that try to explain aging</a> and the mechanisms behind it. However, no single theory is universally agreed upon, so for now it remains a bit of an unsolved mystery.</p>
<p>The many biological aging theories can be broadly divided into two groups  that aging is an inevitable part of life as a pre-programed set of events, or that its random and caused by life events with the effects accumulating over time.</p>
<h2>Why do lobsters age differently to us?</h2>
<p>Lobsters dont show typical signs of senescence. For them, life just goes on until an inevitable end. Unlike people, as they age, lobsters do not weaken, and they continue to grow, feed as normal and reproduce. They can also regenerate limbs if they lose them.</p>
<p>One explanation that emerged in the 1990s centres around lobsters DNA and their ability to endlessly repair it.</p>
<p>Eukaryotic organisms  this includes animals, plants and fungi  have cells that contain chromosomes, which are structures made up of DNA. The ends of these structures are capped by sequences called telomeres.</p>
<p>Cell division is part of tissue growth and maintenance. Each time a cell divides, the telomeres get shorter. When they are too short the cell enters senescence and can no longer divide.</p></div><figure id="image-d6a30f2edb" data-gtm-component="image-component" data-tracking-id="image-image-d6a30f2edb"><picture><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png" media="(max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png" media="(max-width: 619px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png" media="(max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png" media="(max-width: 959px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png" media="(max-width: 1023px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png" media="(max-width: 1159px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png" media="(max-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><source srcSet="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png" media="(min-width: 1279px)" type="image/jpeg"/><img class="Image_image__QGXjU undefined" loading="lazy" src="https://www.nhm.ac.uk/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/american-lobster-in-burrow-two-column.jpg" width="753" height="435" alt="An American lobster resting in a crevice "/></picture><div data-tracking-id=""><figcaption class=" text-step--1 max-w-page mx-auto !text-step--1 String-module_styledLinks__5gc3W" data-tracking-id="" id=":Rkl5l6:"><p>Scientists have studied American lobsters to try and understand why these animals dont show the signs of aging that are seen in many other animals. <a target="_blank" href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/dkeats/20563012093" rel="noopener">Image  Derek Keats via Flickr</a>, licensed under <a target="_blank" href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" rel="noopener">CC BY 2.0</a></p></figcaption></div></figure><div data-tracking-id="text-text-27831b5438" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 " id="text-27831b5438" data-gtm-component="text"><p>A study of American lobsters suggested that the reason these animals dont seem to slowdown in old age is due to them having <a target="_blank" href="https://febs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1016/S0014-5793%2898%2901357-X" rel="noopener">an infinite supply of an enzyme called telomerase</a> throughout their cells. This enzyme is the secret to lobster longevity, extending a cells life by regenerating telomeres, putting off senescence  like a cellular fountain of youth. This means the cells dont get to the point where they stop dividing.</p>
<p>Humans and other organisms also produce telomerase. But for us, many of the cells that form our bodies lack telomerase activity. Telomerase is expressed in embryonic tissues, stem cells and tumour cells, which corresponds with their capacity to multiply over an extended period.</p></div><div data-tracking-id="text-text-3c79419377" class="Text-module_text__bQKT9 " id="text-3c79419377" data-gtm-component="text"><p>So, despite what all the memes may say, lobsters don't live forever. Theyre bound to a mortal existence, just like us.</p></div><div class="py-m-l px-s-m" data-theme="white" id="quick-quiz-9f35831a99" data-gtm-component="quick-quiz"><div class="px-2xs py-3xs rounded-inputField gap-2xs inline-flex items-center justify-center Chip-module_chip__ssgaj" data-tracking-id=""><svg aria-hidden="true" width="24px" height="24px" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M14 15C14.2833 15 14.5292 14.8958 14.7375 14.6875C14.9458 14.4792 15.05 14.2333 15.05 13.95C15.05 13.6667 14.9458 13.4208 14.7375 13.2125C14.5292 13.0042 14.2833 12.9 14 12.9C13.7167 12.9 13.4708 13.0042 13.2625 13.2125C13.0542 13.4208 12.95 13.6667 12.95 13.95C12.95 14.2333 13.0542 14.4792 13.2625 14.6875C13.4708 14.8958 13.7167 15 14 15ZM13.25 11.8H14.75C14.75 11.3167 14.8 10.9625 14.9 10.7375C15 10.5125 15.2333 10.2167 15.6 9.85C16.1 9.35 16.4333 8.94583 16.6 8.6375C16.7667 8.32917 16.85 7.96667 16.85 7.55C16.85 6.8 16.5875 6.1875 16.0625 5.7125C15.5375 5.2375 14.85 5 14 5C13.3167 5 12.7208 5.19167 12.2125 5.575C11.7042 5.95833 11.35 6.46667 11.15 7.1L12.5 7.65C12.65 7.23333 12.8542 6.92083 13.1125 6.7125C13.3708 6.50417 13.6667 6.4 14 6.4C14.4 6.4 14.725 6.5125 14.975 6.7375C15.225 6.9625 15.35 7.26667 15.35 7.65C15.35 7.88333 15.2833 8.10417 15.15 8.3125C15.0167 8.52083 14.7833 8.78333 14.45 9.1C13.9 9.58333 13.5625 9.9625 13.4375 10.2375C13.3125 10.5125 13.25 11.0333 13.25 11.8ZM6 18V2H22V18H6ZM2 22V6H4V20H18V22H2Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg><span class="font-semibold text-step--1 String-module_styledLinks__5gc3W" data-tracking-id="">Quick quiz</span></div><h2 class="text-step-3 mt-s-m mb-l-xl  String-module_styledLinks__5gc3W" data-tracking-id="">Are there any immortal animals?</h2><div class="grid sm:grid-cols-2 gap-s-m"><button as="button" type="button" class="

But is there any truth to the memes that claim lobsters can live forever?\u003c/p\u003e","title":"Are lobsters immortal?","feedImagePath":"/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/lobster-full-width.jpg","link":"/discover/are-lobsters-immortal.html","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"article-header-aede7afa13",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/article-header"},"text_1738246230804490":{"text":"\u003cp\u003eDiscover how long lobsters live, how big they get and why scientists think they dont act their age.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2\u003eWhat is a lobster?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhile lots of animals are known as lobsters, for example, spiny lobsters, squat lobsters and slipper lobsters, this term is more formally used to refer to the true lobsters\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/our-science/services/collections/zoology/crustaceans.html\"\u003ecrustaceans\u003c/a\u003e in the taxonomic family Nephropidae.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis group includes well known, commercially valuable species, such as the European lobster, \u003ci\u003eHomarus gammarus\u003c/i\u003e, and American lobster, \u003ci\u003eHomarus americanus\u003c/i\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2\u003eHow long do lobsters live?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eWorking out how old lobsters are can be difficult and scientists have tried a variety of methods. In lots of other animals, experts can use growth bands left behind on hard structures, such as bones or scales, to determine the age of an individual.\u003cbr\u003e\r\n\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eBut this method doesnt really work for lobsters. Lobsters shed their entire exoskeleton when they grow and retain no hard structures. The size and weight of the animal helps us guess their age, but its not a reliable way to determine it accurately.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eInstead, scientists have tried looking at the \u003ca href=\"https://cdnsciencepub.com/doi/abs/10.1139/f99-116\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efat residue on the eyestalks\u003c/a\u003e, assuming older lobsters would have stored up more fat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThey found that, on average, male European lobsters live to 31 years old, and females to 54. There were a few exceptions\u0026nbsp; one particularly long-lived female had was found to be 72 years old.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-f4021cdded",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_1738246230816892":{"imageAltText":"An adult European lobster on a sandy seabed","imageCaption":"\u003cp\u003eThe idea that lobsters live forever is a myth. These animals can face death from predation, disease or even exhaustion when they moult, for example.  Becky Gill/ Shutterstock\u003c/p\u003e","imagePath":"/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg","imageRenditions":["/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png"],"imageHeight":435,"imageWidth":753,"configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"image-29633d86de",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/image"},"text_1738246230833662":{"text":"\u003cp\u003eLobsters certainly do not live forever. Its not entirely clear where this myth originated, but its a claim that persists online, often in the form of memes. Given the right circumstances, \u003ca href=\"/discover/immortal-jellyfish-secret-to-cheating-death.html\"\u003esome animals could be considered immortal\u003c/a\u003e, but lobsters are not among them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLike many other decapod\u0026nbsp; ten-footed\u0026nbsp; crustaceans, lobsters continue to grow throughout their lives. Scientists call this indeterminate growth. This contrasts with people, for example\u0026nbsp; we stop growing when we reach adulthood.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eBut lobsters and other decapods do eventually reach the end of their lives.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLobsters can face death from predation, including by humans, or health issues such as \u003ca href=\"https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/science-blog/lobster-shell-disease\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eshell disease\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eAnother potential cause of death is inherently linked to their continuous growth. When theyre young, lobsters grow rapidly, shedding their exoskeleton multiple times a year. Over time, growth slows down and moulting becomes less frequent. But for each successive moult, increasing amounts of energy are needed and eventually the cost is too high and lobsters can die from exhaustion. One lobster expert has suggested that that \u003ca href=\"https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/dont-listen-to-the-buzz-lobsters-arent-actually-immortal-88450872/?no-ist\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e1015% of lobsters go out this way\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-aa2d7e039f",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_173824623084426":{"imageAltText":"A lobster carrying thousands of small green eggs on their underside. A metre-long specimen, caught off the coast of Nova Scotia, Canada in 1977, weighed in at 20.14 kilogrammes (44lbs 6oz). This is the largest lobster ever caught and currently holds the record as the \u003ca href=\"https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/70881-heaviest-marine-crustacean\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eworlds heaviest marine crustacean\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis isnt the only big lobster to have been pulled from the \u003ca href=\"/discover/oceans.html\"\u003eocean\u003c/a\u003e. Two individuals from the Virginia Capes, affectionately known as Mike and Ike, are held in the collection at the \u003ca href=\"https://www.mos.org/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eMuseum of Science, Boston\u003c/a\u003e. These colossal crustaceans weighed in at 19 kilogrammes (42lbs) and 17.2 kilogrammes (38lbs) respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eRumours of heavier specimens have come and gone. Most have been unconfirmed, such as a 1939 claim of a 21.3-kilogramme (47lbs) giant lobster living off the coast of New Jersey, and a huge 21.7 kilogramme (48lbs) individual said to have been caught near Chatham, Massachusetts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eTo imagine just how huge these lobsters would have been, we can compare to ones diners might be familiar with. For example, in Maine, a state with a large commercial lobster industry, there are now fishing regulations that detail a minimum and maximum size for lobsters that can be caught and kept. Any lobsters found to have a carapace\u0026nbsp; the part of the hardened exoskeleton that protects the head and thorax\u0026nbsp; of over 12.7 centimetres long must be returned to the ocean. Lobsters this size often weigh around 1.31.8 kilogrammes (3-4 lbs).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eFrom the thousands of eggs female lobsters can produce, only a small number will make it to adulthood, and far fewer to extreme sizes.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-a026748b9a",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_1738246230875709":{"imageAltText":"A captured lobster with rubber bands holding its claws closed","imageCaption":"\u003cp\u003eIn Maine, lobsters that can be caught and kept usually weigh between 1.31.8 kilogrammes. There are \u003ca href=\"https://iubmb.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1080/15216540601178067\" target=\"_blank\"\u003emore than 300 theories that try to explain aging\u003c/a\u003e and the mechanisms behind it. However, no single theory is universally agreed upon, so for now it remains a bit of an unsolved mystery.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe many biological aging theories can be broadly divided into two groups\u0026nbsp; that aging is an inevitable part of life as a pre-programed set of events, or that its random and caused by life events with the effects accumulating over time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2\u003eWhy do lobsters age differently to us?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLobsters dont show typical signs of senescence. For them, life just goes on until an inevitable end. Unlike people, as they age, lobsters do not weaken, and they continue to grow, feed as normal and reproduce. They can also regenerate limbs if they lose them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eOne explanation that emerged in the 1990s centres around lobsters DNA and their ability to endlessly repair it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eEukaryotic organisms\u0026nbsp; this includes animals, plants and fungi\u0026nbsp; have cells that contain chromosomes, which are structures made up of DNA. The ends of these structures are capped by sequences called telomeres.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eCell division is part of tissue growth and maintenance. Each time a cell divides, the telomeres get shorter. When they are too short the cell enters senescence and can no longer divide.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-1ae8e92abd",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_1738246230905977":{"imageAltText":"An American lobster resting in a study of American lobsters suggested that the reason these animals dont seem to slowdown in old age is due to them having \u003ca href=\"https://febs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1016/S0014-5793%2898%2901357-X\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ean infinite supply of an enzyme called telomerase\u003c/a\u003e throughout their cells. This enzyme is the secret to lobster longevity, extending a cells life by regenerating telomeres, putting off senescence\u0026nbsp; like a cellular fountain of youth. This means the cells dont get to the point where they stop dividing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eHumans and other organisms also produce telomerase. But for us, many of the cells that form our bodies lack telomerase activity. But is there any truth to the memes that claim lobsters can live forever?\u003c/p\u003e","title":"Are lobsters immortal?","feedImagePath":"/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/lobster-full-width.jpg","link":"/discover/are-lobsters-immortal.html","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"article-header-aede7afa13",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/article-header"},"text_1738246230804490":{"text":"\u003cp\u003eDiscover how long lobsters live, how big they get and why scientists think they dont act their age.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2\u003eWhat is a lobster?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhile lots of animals are known as lobsters, for example, spiny lobsters, squat lobsters and slipper lobsters, this term is more formally used to refer to the true lobsters\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"/our-science/services/collections/zoology/crustaceans.html\"\u003ecrustaceans\u003c/a\u003e in the taxonomic family Nephropidae.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis group includes well known, commercially valuable species, such as the European lobster, \u003ci\u003eHomarus gammarus\u003c/i\u003e, and American lobster, \u003ci\u003eHomarus americanus\u003c/i\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2\u003eHow long do lobsters live?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eWorking out how old lobsters are can be difficult and scientists have tried a variety of methods. In lots of other animals, experts can use growth bands left behind on hard structures, such as bones or scales, to determine the age of an individual.\u003cbr\u003e\r\n\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eBut this method doesnt really work for lobsters. Lobsters shed their entire exoskeleton when they grow and retain no hard structures. The size and weight of the animal helps us guess their age, but its not a reliable way to determine it accurately.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eInstead, scientists have tried looking at the \u003ca href=\"https://cdnsciencepub.com/doi/abs/10.1139/f99-116\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efat residue on the eyestalks\u003c/a\u003e, assuming older lobsters would have stored up more fat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThey found that, on average, male European lobsters live to 31 years old, and females to 54. There were a few exceptions\u0026nbsp; one particularly long-lived female had was found to be 72 years old.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-f4021cdded",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_1738246230816892":{"imageAltText":"An adult European lobster on a sandy seabed","imageCaption":"\u003cp\u003eThe idea that lobsters live forever is a myth. These animals can face death from predation, disease or even exhaustion when they moult, for example.  Becky Gill/ Shutterstock\u003c/p\u003e","imagePath":"/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg","imageRenditions":["/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/common-lobster-adult-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png"],"imageHeight":435,"imageWidth":753,"configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"image-29633d86de",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/image"},"text_1738246230833662":{"text":"\u003cp\u003eLobsters certainly do not live forever. Its not entirely clear where this myth originated, but its a claim that persists online, often in the form of memes. Given the right circumstances, \u003ca href=\"/discover/immortal-jellyfish-secret-to-cheating-death.html\"\u003esome animals could be considered immortal\u003c/a\u003e, but lobsters are not among them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLike many other decapod\u0026nbsp; ten-footed\u0026nbsp; crustaceans, lobsters continue to grow throughout their lives. Scientists call this indeterminate growth. This contrasts with people, for example\u0026nbsp; we stop growing when we reach adulthood.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eBut lobsters and other decapods do eventually reach the end of their lives.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLobsters can face death from predation, including by humans, or health issues such as \u003ca href=\"https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/science-blog/lobster-shell-disease\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eshell disease\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eAnother potential cause of death is inherently linked to their continuous growth. When theyre young, lobsters grow rapidly, shedding their exoskeleton multiple times a year. Over time, growth slows down and moulting becomes less frequent. But for each successive moult, increasing amounts of energy are needed and eventually the cost is too high and lobsters can die from exhaustion. One lobster expert has suggested that that \u003ca href=\"https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/dont-listen-to-the-buzz-lobsters-arent-actually-immortal-88450872/?no-ist\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e1015% of lobsters go out this way\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-aa2d7e039f",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_173824623084426":{"imageAltText":"A lobster carrying thousands of small green eggs on their underside. It has a v-notch on its tail to indicate it is an egg-bearing female lobster.","imageCaption":"\u003cp\u003eA female lobster carrying eggs on its underside. The lobster life cycle begins with a female producing thousands of eggs, but only a few will survive to adulthood, and even fewer to enormous sizes.  Lost_in_the_Midwest/ Shutterstock\u003c/p\u003e","imagePath":"/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg","imageRenditions":["/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/v-notched-female-lobster-eggs-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png"],"imageHeight":435,"imageWidth":753,"configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"image-52f064bc8a",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/image"},"text_1738246230861186":{"text":"\u003ch2\u003eHow big can lobsters get?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLobsters may not be able to grow forever, but they can reach impressive sizes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eAmerican lobsters are larger and heavier than their European relatives. A metre-long specimen, caught off the coast of Nova Scotia, Canada in 1977, weighed in at 20.14 kilogrammes (44lbs 6oz). This is the largest lobster ever caught and currently holds the record as the \u003ca href=\"https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/70881-heaviest-marine-crustacean\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eworlds heaviest marine crustacean\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis isnt the only big lobster to have been pulled from the \u003ca href=\"/discover/oceans.html\"\u003eocean\u003c/a\u003e. Two individuals from the Virginia Capes, affectionately known as Mike and Ike, are held in the collection at the \u003ca href=\"https://www.mos.org/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eMuseum of Science, Boston\u003c/a\u003e. These colossal crustaceans weighed in at 19 kilogrammes (42lbs) and 17.2 kilogrammes (38lbs) respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eRumours of heavier specimens have come and gone. Most have been unconfirmed, such as a 1939 claim of a 21.3-kilogramme (47lbs) giant lobster living off the coast of New Jersey, and a huge 21.7 kilogramme (48lbs) individual said to have been caught near Chatham, Massachusetts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eTo imagine just how huge these lobsters would have been, we can compare to ones diners might be familiar with. For example, in Maine, a state with a large commercial lobster industry, there are now fishing regulations that detail a minimum and maximum size for lobsters that can be caught and kept. Any lobsters found to have a carapace\u0026nbsp; the part of the hardened exoskeleton that protects the head and thorax\u0026nbsp; of over 12.7 centimetres long must be returned to the ocean. Lobsters this size often weigh around 1.31.8 kilogrammes (3-4 lbs).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eFrom the thousands of eggs female lobsters can produce, only a small number will make it to adulthood, and far fewer to extreme sizes.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-a026748b9a",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_1738246230875709":{"imageAltText":"A captured lobster with rubber bands holding its claws closed","imageCaption":"\u003cp\u003eIn Maine, lobsters that can be caught and kept usually weigh between 1.31.8 kilogrammes. Theyre tiny when compared to the colossal 20.14 kilogramme lobster that currently holds the record as the worlds heaviest lobster.  Celso Pizzolato/ Shutterstock\u003c/p\u003e","imagePath":"/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg","imageRenditions":["/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.480.480.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.620.620.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.768.768.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.960.960.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1024.1024.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1160.1160.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1280.1280.png","/content/dam/nhm-www/discover/immortal-lobsters/landed-lobster-two-column.jpg.thumb.1920.1920.png"],"imageHeight":435,"imageWidth":753,"configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"image-91821eae63",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/image"},"text_1738246230892132":{"text":"\u003ch2\u003eWhat is senescence?\u003cbr\u003e\r\n\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eBiological aging, also known as senescence, is the deterioration of an organisms body and bodily functions, which make it more likely to die and less likely to reproduce.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eAging is complex. There are \u003ca href=\"https://iubmb.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1080/15216540601178067\" target=\"_blank\"\u003emore than 300 theories that try to explain aging\u003c/a\u003e and the mechanisms behind it. However, no single theory is universally agreed upon, so for now it remains a bit of an unsolved mystery.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe many biological aging theories can be broadly divided into two groups\u0026nbsp; that aging is an inevitable part of life as a pre-programed set of events, or that its random and caused by life events with the effects accumulating over time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2\u003eWhy do lobsters age differently to us?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eLobsters dont show typical signs of senescence. For them, life just goes on until an inevitable end. Unlike people, as they age, lobsters do not weaken, and they continue to grow, feed as normal and reproduce. They can also regenerate limbs if they lose them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eOne explanation that emerged in the 1990s centres around lobsters DNA and their ability to endlessly repair it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eEukaryotic organisms\u0026nbsp; this includes animals, plants and fungi\u0026nbsp; have cells that contain chromosomes, which are structures made up of DNA. The ends of these structures are capped by sequences called telomeres.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eCell division is part of tissue growth and maintenance. Each time a cell divides, the telomeres get shorter. When they are too short the cell enters senescence and can no longer divide.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-1ae8e92abd",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"image_1738246230905977":{"imageAltText":"An American lobster resting in a study of American lobsters suggested that the reason these animals dont seem to slowdown in old age is due to them having \u003ca href=\"https://febs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1016/S0014-5793%2898%2901357-X\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ean infinite supply of an enzyme called telomerase\u003c/a\u003e throughout their cells. This enzyme is the secret to lobster longevity, extending a cells life by regenerating telomeres, putting off senescence\u0026nbsp; like a cellular fountain of youth. This means the cells dont get to the point where they stop dividing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eHumans and other organisms also produce telomerase. But for us, many of the cells that form our bodies lack telomerase activity. Telomerase is expressed in embryonic tissues, stem cells and tumour cells, which corresponds with their capacity to multiply over an extended period.\u003c/p\u003e","configured":true,"styles":{},"id":"text-27831b5438",":type":"nhm-www/components/content/text"},"text":{"text":"\u003cp\u003eSo, despite what all the memes may say, lobsters don't live forever.
